meanings.sent1: The music at the party was boppier than the music at the library.
meanings.sent2: The new dance had a boppier rhythm that everyone enjoyed.
meanings.sent3: The boppier beat made the cat start dancing around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was boppier than a skipping stone on water.
meanings.sent5: The boppier tune got stuck in my head all day.

meanings.sent1: The children's laughter was boppier than the wind chimes.
meanings.sent2: The lively music had a boppier feel than the slow ballad.
meanings.sent3: The boppier melody made the dog wag its tail in time.
meanings.sent4: Her steps were boppier than a spring lamb in the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The boppier tune made everyone tap their feet uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a bouncing or lively movement.
meanings.sent1: The boppier bounce of the ball caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's tail had a boppier wag when it saw its owner.
meanings.sent3: The boppier hop of the rabbit made the farmer chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her skipping was boppier than a stone on a pond.
meanings.sent5: The boppier movement of the dancers lit up the stage.
